name: ampliseq-16s-bacterial
title: 16S Bacterial Community Profiling (nf-core/ampliseq)
description: Characterize bacterial communities from 16S rRNA V3-V4 amplicon sequencing data using the nf-core/ampliseq pipeline. Performs quality control, ASV inference with DADA2, taxonomic classification using SILVA database, and generates comprehensive diversity metrics and visualizations for microbiome research.
content:
16S Bacterial Community Profiling

The nf-core/ampliseq pipeline analyzes 16S rRNA amplicon sequencing data to characterize bacterial communities. This Camber app is pre-configured with V3-V4 region primers and the SILVA taxonomic database for robust bacterial identification.

What This Pipeline Does

  • Quality Control: Assess read quality with FastQC
  • Primer Trimming: Remove primers using Cutadapt
  • ASV Inference: Generate Amplicon Sequence Variants with DADA2
  • Taxonomic Classification: Assign taxonomy using SILVA database
  • Diversity Analysis: Calculate alpha and beta diversity metrics
  • Visualization: Generate interactive reports and plots

Input Requirements

Provide a CSV samplesheet with the following columns:

  • sampleID: Unique sample identifier
  • forwardReads: Path/URL to R1 FASTQ file
  • reverseReads: Path/URL to R2 FASTQ file
  • run: Sequencing run identifier

Key Outputs

  • ASV Table: dada2/ASV_table.tsv - Counts per sample
  • Taxonomy: dada2/ASV_tax.tsv - Taxonomic assignments
  • Diversity Metrics: qiime2/diversity/ - Alpha/beta diversity
  • QC Report: multiqc/multiqc_report.html - Comprehensive QC

Biological Context

This pipeline targets the V3-V4 hypervariable region of the bacterial 16S rRNA gene, providing species-level resolution for most bacterial taxa. The SILVA database ensures high-quality taxonomic assignments for comprehensive microbiome characterization.

Note: Primers are hardcoded for the V3-V4 region (GTGYCAGCMGCCGCGGTAA / GGACTACNVGGGTWTCTAAT). SILVA database is automatically downloaded during pipeline execution.
